context: Any CBD plants?

I bet they have already grown pot up there, on those months-year long missions.  Not like they will be reporting on that anytime soon and probably some fermented fruit product brewing somewhere deep and dark onboard.  Prolly not a good place to cook meth...

Honestly, these NASA plant stories are funny.
"Advanced Plant Habitat"? I have one in my basement. Tomatoes, peppers and cucumbers for years. I didn't even need to spend billions of dollars to find out plants only need a few things to flourish.
Congrats to NASA for discovering hydroponics that have been in use for centuries.
Oh, they're also using the cheapest Chinese grow lights available. Great job NASA!

üå∂  Space...the final nursery.  These are the gardens of the ISS, whose neverending mission is to grow some radical radishes, some killer carrots, and some bodacious buds.  Live long and irrigate...
ü•ï ü•¶üçÑ

Nuke submarines have been growing veggies for a long time now. The Navy also has experimented with hydroponics since WW2. There's lots of previous research. Absence of gravity is the trickiest part. Most seeds direction of root growth is determined by gravity.
I grow  tomatoes, mixed lettuce, cukes, radishes and a bell pepper plant in a 3'X3' corner of my bedroom every winter. A fresh picked salad in February will brighten your day. My neighbor gets a tomato every week or so out of it and is starting her garden next winter. The best part, the electricity is what I would heat the apartment with anyway so there is not one penny of extra cost. I'm surprised more people don't do this.

context: Stoned in Space...far out...
Wouldn't Chia Pets work up there?  I'm sure they could find edible plants to grow in them.  And, a lot cheaper.
If you look closely you can see cheeto dust everywhere.

I doubt anyone really thought there would be people living in space for even a day 100 years ago. I am still amazed every time I watch the ISS go over. We are getting there slowly but surely. A lot to figure out, but a lot of very smart and imaginative people working on it.
